title: Universal generalization
summary: In predicate logic, generalization (also universal generalization or universal introduction,[1][2][3] GEN) is a valid inference rule. It states that if ⊢ P ( x ) {\displaystyle \vdash \!P(x)} has been derived, then ⊢ ∀ x P ( x ) {\displaystyle \vdash \!\forall x\,P(x)} can be derived.
